Reviews.Title: “Our stay”
Reviews.Author: judi48
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every time we are in the Dallas area..The staff is awesome and we are comfortable there..We have never had a problem ... I have even stayed there alone and felt very safe..The hotel could stand to be remodeled but certainly is not a dump..The hotel is pet friendly..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: char06
Reviews.Content: Older hotel. Check-in took forever however all employees were very helpful throughout our stay. The rooms were a bit on the small side and reflected the hotel's age but were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The lobby and restaurant seemed updated, nicer than hallways and rooms. My family greatly enjoyed the indoor/outdoor pool. It was a bit cold however. Kids eat free in restaurant. Fun waitstaff. Standard hotel breakfast buffet. Close to the Galleria. Would stay here again for the price we found online.

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice clean room and Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: martin p
Reviews.Content: We stay here often due to a son who attends college in the area. Although the hallways are not always the nicest, the rooms always impress. Rooms are large and clean as well as comfortable beds. Breakfast buffet/omelet bar are a great value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: GEMreaux
Reviews.Content: The friendliness of the staff could not quite overcome the poorer aspects of this hotel. The ceiling was leaking on our floor and we had to step around 3 garbage cans collecting water every time we accessed the elevator. Stale smoke permeated every hallway. The heating/air unit did not work in our room. While convenient to our route through Dallas, the area seems shady. Fortunately, the hotel had a restaurant so we didn't have to venture out into a part of Dallas that seems run down.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: thefamilythattravels
Reviews.Content: I stay here often and it is well located, usually clean, rooms are comfortable, has nice bar/tv area, good fitness room and a good breakfast. you'll pay for the breakfast but it is good, omlett bar, fruit, meats, etc....

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel that Really cares about its customer”
Reviews.Author: steve v
Reviews.Content: We have been staing at this older Hotel for years and although showing its age the rooms are comfortable (just ask for the FEATHURE PILLOWS)The standard pillows are terrible. The restaurant is one of the best you will find in any Hioliday inn Hotel. The management is absolutely the best and they truly care .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel bad location”
Reviews.Author: leslie V
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through hotwire and got a great deal, but didn't really know where the hotel would be but it said it was close to the location I needed. I guess I should have checked into that a little more. I did not feel unsafe and the room was clean and staff was nice. But on the last night of my stay my car was broken into. Although that is not the hotel's fault, there are no security cameras in the parking lot. The damage to my car and the personal loss more than makes up the money I saved booking through hotwire. Not a good experience for us. It is a shame because it is a nice hotel. Just needs security and cameras because of it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Mur018
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here three nights. We were pleasantly surprised. It is a nice hotel. The room was clean and quiet. We never heard another guest the whole time we were there. Bathroom was recently remodeled and the shower was awesome. The bed was big and comfortable. The TV was old and needed replaced. NIce chairs and furniture. Throw in the microwave, fridge and free wireless makes an added plus. We ate a couple of meals at the restaurant and it was very good. We used the indoor-outdoor pool and hot tub. It was very nice. That set up is very hard to find. Good job here Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: Although there will not be many Holiday Inn Select left out there these days, this property reminds me why I like the Selects better than the Holiday Inn Express. The service was outstanding for a Holiday Inn standard. The receptionist was really polite when checking in around 6pm, and the next morning around 11am when checking out, the same warm greeting was rendered by a different receptionist as well. The shuttle driver who stood next to the door also say good bye to me which I totally did not expect these days. Sure, the property is a bit dated, but the room is clean and adequate. A nice stay over all at North side of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for business. Would return.”
Reviews.Author: chas77777
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9/12/11 thru 9/15/11. Hotel desk clerks were very nice, our room was clean and comfortable. We were on the forth floor next to the elevator and laundry. I figured this was going to suck but I never heard anyone outside the room unless they were being excessibly noisy. Food there was great in the restaurant and room service was quick and very polite. Housekeeping did an excellent job keeping us supplied with towels, soap, coffee, and drinking glasses. We didn't have to ask for anything. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarsonuk
Reviews.Content: Rooms are dirty, hotel is in a dodgy area. Wouldnt recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire and Priceline bookees, look here!”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: After recieving this as the hotel chosen by Hotwire as a 3 star hotel, and reading the reviews, I was pretty scared. Now I still dont think this is a 3 star hotel, but it was mostly clean, aside from a few messes that people left where they shouldnt have. I think that the cleaning crew of this hotel is understaffed for sure. But my room was comfortable and clean. Hotel was quiet and right next to the hwy. There were no hooligans or ruffians waiting to break into your car or rough you up on your way to your room like other reviews mentioned. Foodwise I didnt eat here. It says that there is a restaurant attached to the hotel, but it is just a hotel type cafe. Didnt offer much of a selection, hours are definately not for the night owl, and the one time I put the doortag out to recieve breakfast in my room nobody came to collect it and was out of luck according to the guy at the front desk. For the price I paid I am satisfied with what I got. But not a 3 star hotel, and if I had to stay here again I wouldnt be as upset as I was when I booked.

Reviews.Title: “The best we have experienced world wide!”
Reviews.Author: kylie720199
Reviews.Content: Ok previous bloggers, it might not be in the hub of action but the courtesy bus staff went over and beyond to take us anywhere we needed to fulfill our stay at the Holiday Inn Galleria. We have travelled the world and NEVER have we experienced better service form all personnel. The hotel is a little aged but very clean, the inhouse dining great price-wise, an excellent indoor-outdoor pool and the 3 guest laundries are the cheapest we have experienced. See you in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: MrsLadyA
Reviews.Content: This visit was for business and I would NEVER stay here again. The staff was RUDE! The hotel had mold, bugs, and who knows what else. The food was extremely poor quality and selection was not great. Also, there were only 4 washers and 4 dryers and 1 of each was working.

Reviews.Title: “I can't say I would suggest this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: cjc1977
Reviews.Content: I felt like the rooms were not modern in my opinion..The bed I did not care for..The food at the hotel was good..

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: BlueHeeler777
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and neat enough. It's a large hotel with a great inside/outside pool area. There were certainly good restaurant options in the hotel, but not much close to it outside unless you wanted to walk a little way. Rooms were pretty clean but a bit older than some around. However, the price we got was very good--just over $50 per night. so in terms of overall value it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Gomavsdallas
Reviews.Content: The wifi is not working. The router drops you at a random chance. There are like 5 people in the front desk and 4 of them are American Africans and 1 of them is a local girl with hair colored red. When they gave me my bill I found they charged me with someone else's VISA card. If I hadn't mentioned that to them, that VISA holder would pay my bill. I bet that you don't wanna pay someone else's bill with your card. The hotel is old. Outside the room is dirty. Room is fair. In sum, AVOID this place.

Reviews.Title: “The other reviews of this hotel had me worried~loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Tootsie1969
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, but very well kept. The staff goes out of their way to help you and the rooms were nice. So many reviews mentioned the elevator being broken and one is but there are 6 elevators. Three sets of two, so one being out isn't a problem. The lobby and restaurant in the hotel is awesome. The check in clerks were awesome and prompt 3 at the desk. The area did not seem scary at all was in a very nice neighbor hood. I hate it is rated so low because it is a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Very overrated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jhogg83
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of negative points I would like to point out for this hotel. First, this Holiday Inn is possibly in one of the worst locations that one could possibly be in. If you're not familiar to this area and even if you are, please stay away from this hotel and take the extra time and head east on I-635 to a more decent and safer hotel. Second, the rooms for this hotel are no better than a MOTEL that you see on the side of road/ highway ( I would say more but I'm trying to make this family friendly). From walking through the lobby, hallways, even in the room there's a lingering smoke/ dirty/ musky smell. Also, throughout the night since the walls for the room we were staying in were so thin, we heard our neighbors TV throughout the entire night as well as everyone walking through the halls. So for this hotel to be rated a 3 star hotel it is very misleading. Third, and most importantly, was security. Of course because of this area, the first question I asked the employee at the front desk before we checked in was how is security in and around the hotel. The lady at the lobby guranteed me that nothing would happen because there is security in the parking lot 24 hours with multiple officers. Needless to say my truck was stolen from the front of the hotel. There was not multiples but only 1 security guard that works through the night and they leave around 4am. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy because it was just a horrible experience. The only thing good I can say that came from my trip was that I know exactly where not to go again and hopefully from this review other people would not stay here either to avoid having a terrible experience of their own.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with dumb and dumber”
Reviews.Author: Kauppianni
Reviews.Content: The rooms are filthy and ill-maintained, the service is non attentive and non caring, and the entire staff seems like they're here because they failed as burger flippers somewhere else. We landed here superbowl weekend because there weren't any better options. At any other time, anything else would be a better option, including sleeping in the car. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but just okay”
Reviews.Author: Knights82
Reviews.Content: Had to make a quick trip to Dallas and was awarded this hotel via Priceline. At $34 a night for three nights, it's hard to complain too much. While the rooms are okay, the entire facility is overdue for a re-fresh. Pros: Free Wi-Fi, location (next to the freeway), price Cons: Tired decor, dreary elevators & hallways, soap (only one bar)! Also, the Galleria is 2+ miles east of the hotel. So visitors wanting a hotel within walking distance of the Galleria should probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will return”
Reviews.Author: dude4da
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days last week, 2 business, 2 bluegrass festival. Big -- 377 rooms and all were full 3 nights. The staff was super from the front desk to the shuttle driver to the maids they were healpful and anxious to please. An older property with older carpets, etc. but they were more than made up for by the size of the rooms and the cheerful, friendly service. A number of people in our group were from out of state and shocked at how the staff would go out of its way to help the guests. The food was good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericsf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Holiday Inn Select for two nights. All I can say is the hotel is absolutely filthy. The hallways are dark and smell. My room looked very dated and had a very odd odor. Several times I spotted bugs inthe bathroom and cockroaches crawling on the carpet in my room.The elevators were either old and slow or broken entirely. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: GoingIntoTheWorld
Reviews.Content: This was quite possibly the most disgusting hotel I have ever been to! Upon arrival, the outside of the building has paint peeling, and few cars in the parking lot. Maybe not a huge deal, but it was evidence of what was yet to come. Walking in the hallways to find our rooms (hallways that were a maze with poor directions to room numbers), we found ourselves in the midst of low ceilings, lights out, elevators not working, and a damp must smell. Upon arrival to the room, we were hit with the smell of what can only be described as cat urine! Sickening! And, the damp, musty smell and feel was everywhere. Needless to say, even though we had pre-paid for the room and could not get a refund, and even though we were traveling on a tight budget, we left and found another place. I would especially caution females traveling alone about staying here. The maze of dark, damp, and must hallways, with elevators not working, would seem to be to be an unsafe situation!

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovations, not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: bufam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in a two month period, for a week each time. Both times all but one set of elevators were out of order. The elevators that were in order were on the opposite side of the building from our room. The rooms are musty smelling and the carpet is constantly damp from the humidity (they need to dehumidify rooms and clean carpets). The bathrooms were VERY small but clean and well stocked. The bed linens were good (down comforters etc.). However, the bed skirts looked like they were rarely if ever cleaned and were stained (one room we had I noticed blood stains on the skirt the night before we left). The rooms do not have flat panel TV's and very limited number of TV channels. The internet is highly unreliable and times out often. This is a HUGE problem if you are traveling for business. I tried to conduct a teleconference over the net and it was imposible. The computers in the "business center" (which is in the lobby and not private) had signs on them that said they were out of order. The hallways in the guest room areas were extremely hot and humid (seems like they need new, and more, a/c units in there). The pool has the potential to be a very nice area, there are courtyards etc. However, the glass wall between the inside and outside pool has a ton of calcium buildup and corrosion from chlorine all over it. Make the whole area seem icky. The pool itself was clean and clear as was the jacuzzi and there were plenty of towells supplied. The bar looked OK, I didn't visit it but there were a good number of folks there watching a ball game and seemed to be having a good time. Our first visit the restaurant, Zaya's, was closed the entire time (very inconvenient). The second trip the restaurant was open but WAY over priced (expected for an in house restaurant) and there was not a complimentary continental breakfast. Rooms service was very slow but friendly and the food was good. All in all it was an OK stay though I would not stay at this hotel again. For the price there are better places.

Reviews.Title: “They made it right”
Reviews.Author: swhittOK
Reviews.Content: Checked in late at night - room had a terrible odor and I thought turning on the A/C would help. It didn't. Killed 4 bugs, 2 on the bed. Too tired to deal with it but the next morning asked for another room and explained the situation. They made it right and gave me a room with no odor and no bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Works for the Everyday Traveler”
Reviews.Author: courtcro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my volleyball team during a Dallas Qualifier, and everyone seemed content with the hotel choice. The front desk staff is composed of several employees that aren't the nicest people in the world, but they get the job done. The woman working at the concierge, however, was very sweet and helpful. There is a large touch screen board when you walk in, and it provides information and directions regarding shops, restaurants, and popular attractions. This was a nice feature. The rooms are nice, what you would expect with a Holiday Inn Select. Although I didn't have a chance to go swimming, the indoor/outdoor pool is really neat, and the jacuzzi is pretty roomy. The fitness center has 4 treadmills along with other exercise machines. It was a good collection for the hotel, I wasn't expecting the exercise facility to be that nice. There is a decent restaurant and bar right off the hotel lobby. They have a continental breakfast or a buffet, both are availible. The buffet isn't that extensive, but it serves its purpose. The men working at the restaurant don't speak the best English, and they seem to make everything more complicated than it should be, but they were hard workers. Something that really impressed me was the fact that we called the restaurant and asked them to stay open for our team to come eat after we finished late. They stayed open an extra 45 minutes for us to eat, and that was great customer service. The food tasted good, and not one person in our group complained about the quality of their food. So the other reviews you may read about the food, just remember: there are picky people out there who will find something wrong with everything. Considering everyone in a group of 20 people enjoyed the food, I'd say it it's pretty quality. Overall, the hotel is nothing special by any means, but it's a great place to stay for a weekend trip in Dallas. Only 5-10 minutes away from the Galleria, and about 15 minutes away from Northpark, it's convenient for the shoppers. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare of All Hotels”
Reviews.Author: sarah_miller78
Reviews.Content: well to start off my stay as i was checking in first of all i wasn`t greeted then i stood there for 5 minutes listening to conversation about them allowing a pimp stay there every week to pimp out his prostitutes by a heavy set lady and a tall guy before anyone notice i was even standing there. the check in was horrible very rude woman who happened to be the front desk manager jennifer i believe. extremely unprofessional if you ask me. later i asked about the shuttle asked if they could take me to the american airlines arena not realizing they only go 5 miles from the hotel, then the young man matt starts to hustle me for money saying he is willing to take me there as long as i keep it on the down low and pay him 40 dollars for him risking his job? who would risk a job for 40 dollars???? the other front desk who is an older Hispanic woman was yelling on the phone. Food was horrible and very over priced. the rooms are dingy, smells of mildew, heater did not work, toilet wouldn`t stop running, and could get any towels sent up to my room. this is honestly the worst hotel i have ever stayed at. DO NOT STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: HappyTXgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this for $40 on Hotwire. It was a good deal for the price. The hotel staff was great. The beds were great. The pool was a little cloudy but not bad. This isn't a bad hotel but a little old.

Reviews.Title: “Had Fun!”
Reviews.Author: MilwaukeeDoyle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what you'd expect from a Holiday Inn. Comfortable, affordable with no frills. Had a co-ed soccer group going on. A lot of kids! Even so, very quiet. The swimming pool was great! Cold, but great! Clean, and not too crowded even tho the hotel was full. Go for the breakfast option. The staff was helpful and very friendly. GET A G.P.S. if traveling to this area, if you're not familiar with the area. Very easy to get lost!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - nowhere near as bad as some people make out”
Reviews.Author: RapidAssistant
Reviews.Content: My main reason for choosing this hotel was that it was closest to the business park in which I was working, and its location meant that I could drive there using the local roads without having to suffer the heavily congested freeways in the morning. First impressions were good, although the "official" pictures of the lobby and public areas do flatter the place a bit - it's a mite darker than in the photos. Nonetheless, the public parts of the hotel (e.g the lobby, bar, restaurant, swimming pool area and conference rooms) were all spotlessly clean, and in tip-top condition. A lot of reviewers have criticised this hotel for being "old" and "dated", but that isn't necessarily a problem as long as everything is clean and well-maintained - which was definately the case on the ground floor. Yes it IS true that the guest room corridors and the elevators need a LOT of work, and they do have a musky smell to them. Nothing that new carpets and wallpaper wouldn't sort out - at least these are not the areas you sleep in after all, but all the detail fixtures and fittings like signs, lamp fittings and door handles all look old and worn out. Likewise the elevators felt really old and decrepit - and noisy - anyone allocated a room on the top floor near the elevators would no doubt have to put up with the noise from the machinery. Once in the rooms however, it gets a lot better. My bathroom at least was refurbished with new tiles and sanitaryware, but it lost marks for a toilet cistern that kept on topping itself up every half an hour (irritating when you were trying to get to sleep!). The rooms were palatial, the beds comfortable and the linen was clean and fresh. Another bit of tattiness comes from the old and noisy air conditioning/heating units by the windows. They really could do with some replacement. Personally, I found the restaurant food OK, but a bit ordinary, so I followed the usual pattern when it came to eating out once I had my bearings of the area, there was a large strip of restaurants in nearby Irving (about 10 minutes along I-635W) that I ended up going to - don't read too much into the claim that it is in the "Galleria Area" - it is in fact 6 miles along the pretty hare 'em scare 'em freeway. As others have mentioned, the breakfasts in the hotel are excellent and good value ($9.95), and there is a chef on-hand to cook omelets and scrambled eggs to order. All of the staff in the hotel were polite, eager to help and everything that I asked for was done expediently. As there were business conferences in the hotel pretty much every night I was there, there were always interesting people to strike up a conversation with in the bar in the evenings. Overall, I was pleased with this hotel. It isn't as bad as people on here have said, and it certainly doesn't warrant a one or two star rating. Bear in mind its location - I certainly wouldn't consider it if you don't have a car as there is no public transport nearby and there isn't very much in the way of restaurants or amenities within walking distance. The poor condition of the lobbys and the ordinaryness of the restaurant is the main reason why I'm giving it a 3 rating instead of 4. In short it's one of those hotels you wouldn't have any regrets about choosing, or being allocated by your employer, but given a free hand you would probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Look somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: railroader1
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a group for a meeting. The hallways are small low ceilings. Thebhotel has a constant smell of dinifectent and bleach. The elevators are slow and creaky. The room had a uncomfortable bed. The hotel needs updating badly. For teh prioce go to Addison Road Marriott. The neighborhood is ok, next a office building, and the Freeway. There was food in the hallways and just another example of a Holiday Inn experience. Avoid this place

Reviews.Title: “The place to go!”
Reviews.Author: lifesonice
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night over New Year's Eve. I arrived early to walk the place and take a look at my room before going out. Upon my arrival I was greeted by a friendly staff and a really nice lobby area. The area rugs were nice and clean and so were the restrooms. I was pleased to know that my room was available. I walked the hallways and they didn't smell bad. They could use brighter lights. The room, well, I'm not sure if they had remodeled the rooms since these other people went but they were great. The bed was nicely made and appealing and the room was clean. Nothing smelled musty to me. In fact the rooms smelled fresh. The gym was ok, except that the carpet should be replaced. The pool area was clean, and the hot tub was hot. The lounge/bar has a great atmosphere. It made me feel as if I went out to the local pub. The breakfast was great! They have a cook making omelettes and waffles at your order and have a variety of options. The place could use a modern touch, compared to other hotels double the price, but it's not as bad as others made it sound. I would recommend this place and for the way things are going if you want you're dollars to go further for less, this is the place to go. Plus it's right off a main highway which makes everything 30 minutes away or closer.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: flores403
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel through priceline and at first I thought we got a very good deal at $45+ for the night espeicially once I saw the website i was directed too and thought WOW nice hotel. Like other reviews the hotel was not in the best neighborhood especially when they map it in the Galleria area of Dallas NOT!!! The apperance of the hotel from the outside is ok but once inside it does not get any better really. The hallways have very low ceilings and yes are dingy and it smells between smoke and molding. Walking through the hallways you think it might get better but it doesn't. We get to our room sheets were ok thought you would get better looking at what there webiste offers and photo gallery. There pool from there site again looked extremely big but there outside and inside pool were in fact small and very cold, there hot tubs is nothing to brag about either and that was a main factor of booking this hotel was so my boys could enjoy the pool again NOT!!!! There gym needs to be updated and yes old and dingy in there as well. Hell the whole hotel needs to be udpated. I was so disapointed w/ the hotel b/c I thought that the Holiday Inns are represented way better then what I saw and had to stay in. I was so disapointed that I wanted to leave as soon as I got there and had my mind set to leave but since my boys were tired we stayed. There breakfast was probably the only good thing about this hotel b/c kids eat free but you'll pay 10 bucks pp which is ok but don't think you'll get the best of foods but it will do but I will say the service for breakfast was good the waiters were very nice but this hotel SUCKS and I don't recommended anyone to stay!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps The Worst Hotel on Earth”
Reviews.Author: sadindallas
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs! I don't know how many employees they have writing reviews on this site, but the actual hotel is NOTHING like what has been described by other users. The entryways and hallways are crawling with beetles and crickets. The elevators are hit or miss with several people trapped more than once during my stay. Our car was broken into in the parking lot. This should not have come as a surprise as the neighborhood that surrounds the property is the very worst kind of ghetto. Upon entering my room, I encountered more bugs. I woke the first morning feeling "itchy". The red rash seemed like a bed bug infestation to me, but the management assured me that it was not. I finally checked out of the hell-hole after finding a pair of worn panties under my bed and a crackpipe in my coffee maker. There is no amount of money that anyone could ever PAY ME to get me to stay here again. The front desk staff is rude and do not care what kind of stay you are having. Management is no better. After getting my window fixed on my car, this stay at a very bad hotel cost me more than a luxury hotel stay. I hope no one else ever has to experience this terrible excuse for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: mslibra80
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over the 4th of July weekend. The room was great. It was clean and very comfortable. I didnt expect the room to be so decent while walking thru the hall to our room - the halls are a bit smokey and dingy. But heck, you don't sleep there. They definitely make up for it inside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mler13
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Got a double room for one night. Clean with a decent amount of room. Beds are comfy. Has a nice indoor/outdoor pool. Staff is friendly. Breakfast not always included with your room but they do have a nice restaurant with a hot breakfast buffet, lunch, and dinner. Lots of parking. 5 -min drive to the Galleria Mall or IMax theatre.

Reviews.Title: “nice holiday inn”
Reviews.Author: Robyn80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a soccer tournament and the hotel is larger than a typical holiday inn and the staff were very kind and helpful. It is not within walking distance to any stores or restaurants but is conveniently placed within a ten minute car ride to anything you can think of. The hotel room's are average and about on target with other Holiday Inn's I have stayed at. The hotel offers free wi-fi in the lobby and rooms and has a computer and printer in the lobby for our use. The hotel has an indoor/outdoor pool and hot tub as well. We did not use on our trip but it was nice to walk by or sit by. There is also a bar and restaurant onsite - convenient for late night arrivals or for a drink without having to go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Priceline hotel. Vehicle a Must.”
Reviews.Author: garfodie
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly adequate hotel to get on Priceline, but it could use a little TLC. Booked a Saturday+Sunday night for $42 on priceline (it comes to about $52 per night after taxes). The hotel is right on the highway, but it's a little tricky to access by car (I ended up making a few u-turns to get to the place -- grab a GPS unit, or get a good set of maps before arriving). But by being right on the highway means that you can reach downtown by car in about 20 minutes in non-peak-hour traffic. A vehicle is a must. Public transit is non-existent, and it's awkward to access nearby restaurants without a car. Initial impressions of the hotel (from the lobby) are good. Lobby is fresh, clean, and must be newly renovated. There are (free) public internet access terminals, plus free in-room wi-fi. The atrium is modern and clean too, with the fitness centre, pool, and hot tub. The hotel hallways, though, could use some work. Drab 1980's carpeting, weak lighting, peeling paint meant that the walk to the room was rather depressing. The room itself was perfectly acceptable. The bed and pillows were comfortable. TV channel selection was present but limited. There were modern fixtures in the bathroom (that could use a fresh coat of paint). The cleaning staff are erratic, but they generally do a decent job. I don't know what people are talking about with a "free breakfast" (must be for conferences), but you can grab some bread from a Wal-Mart nearby. When they publish, you get a USA Today at the door of your room. If you get a room at the back, you usually don't have to worry about aircraft or freeway noises. All in all, don't be worried when you get this hotel on priceline. (Though, certainly do not pay rack rate for this hotel.) While the hotel can certainly put some money into modernizing the hallways, the indoor pool, free parking and Internet is a plus, and it's easily accessible to much of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New rooms and Free hot fresh cooked breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lisamarieFLA
Reviews.Content: I was worried about this hotel when we read the reviews, but they were all BS! Yes they HAD ( past tense) older rooms but they have been renovated and all are new and very nice, especially upper floor rooms 3 and above. First we got the room with Priority Club and they had a special for 5000 points per night, so we got 4 nights FREE for the price of one normally. The room was brand new, and immaculate. Nice, upscale decor. A awesome VERY COMFORTABLE bed! Super soft linens. Nice toiletries. Clean, new bath. We had a laundry on the floor which was great. The breakfast bar was excellent-a person making hot fresh cooked eggs, pancakes, and waffles. Lots of lovely fresh fruit. Good coffee. YUM! The staff was very nice and helpful. Our waitress Cecilia was a doll-we had her every day! They could not do enough for us. I noted the regular rate is only $72 with AAA in the winter-a deal! Since my friend's home is close by ( 4 miles) in a nice area of Dallas I will definitely be back the next time I visit her in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “nice conference hotel in dallas”
Reviews.Author: trinity-tiger
Reviews.Content: i attended a modest size (300) person conference at this hotel - the room was nice, the conference facilities nice, the restaurant good (the breakfast bufet was a good deal at 9.95) and the complimentary airport shuttle to dfw was nice (it'savailable to love field, a detriment to those who some to dallas via southwest) - one comment though is that our hospitality suit eon the 6th floor did not have a rest room - what a bummer - i had to use one of the host committeee's rooms or else go downstairs to use - not a good idea - i would recommnd this place though for anyone planning a conference

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are not 3* Quality”
Reviews.Author: Shrew00
Reviews.Content: Can't complain about the price, as I got it for $42 through Priceline. This is listed as a 3* hotel on Priceline. This may be the case in amenities (i.e. fitness center, restaurant, room service, business center). But the rooms are nothing close to 3* in quality. I have seen better 1* rooms than this hotel. First off, I was given a first floor room. Upon entering, I immediately noticed a musty, moldy smell. The rooms look like they were renovated circa early 1990s. The bathrooms look more like circa 1980s and desperately need a remodel. Had I paid full price for this hotel, I'd been extremely upset. Positives: Room was fairly quiet. Water pressure in shower was great. Breakfast buffet was ok. Free internet access at business center. Bed was comfortable, and I got a good night's rest. Negatives: Awful rooms on par with what I would expect at an EconoLodge, not a Holiday Inn Select. Bathrooms are slightly scary as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: easytogetalongwith
Reviews.Content: 3 Stars...? Puh-leeese. 1st impression, dingy carpet and nasty walls throughout the entire hotel, vague smoky smell. Got into room at 2:30 AM and sink was full of putrit residue, clogged as if someone had vomited and no one bothered to clear the pipes. In the light of day, no improvement. Next day, got back from meeting at 2:30, one of two double beds (the one I slept in) had sheets ripped off and comforter and pillows piled on top. Left room and came back at 4:30, (housekeeping carts in the hall since 8:30 AM) had not been touched, towels still on the floor in bathroom, etc. Left and came back at 7:30, room still had not been touched. Finally complained and engineer who barely spoke English poured Drano in sink and split quickly. Housekeeping still has not shown up in over an hour. Nothing worthwhile to drink or eat within miles, no decent shuttle anywhere worthwhile. Do yourself a favor and do not stay here for any reason whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “shabby yet endearing”
Reviews.Author: coando
Reviews.Content: I shuddered when I "won" the Holiday Inn Select hotel on Priceline ($42, 2.5 * NW Dallas area) Usually Priceline Holiday Inns are musty, creepy antiquated ordeals; this hotel was musty but fun! I enjoyed it much more than the DFW Hyatt Regency I stayed at the week before on my way out of town. Tho not located exactly at the airport, the Holiday Inn Select is very much an airport hotel, only about 15 minutes away from DFW. Flight crews were coming and going at all hours. It's much more reasonably priced than the hotels right at the airport, and the restaurant was suprisingly delicious! My spinach salad was emmense, with fresh tasty ingredients, and only $6.95! The hotel building itself is from another era, huge, sprawling and mazelike, with a giant lobby, resplendant in it's faded 1980s decor, which the lower floor rooms open up directly into. Besides the restaurant the lobby includes a bar, a nice workout room, and an indoor/outdoor pool. The rooms themselves, however, are another story. I checked out 3 different rooms before finally settling on the least of the evils. The first room was on the second floor and tho musty, would have been acceptable- execpt the entire ceiling was vibrating like a boom box car with frightening metallic bangs and thuds! I went back to the front desk, and after thourough interrogation the clerk finally revealed that there just might be "a little construction" going on on the third floor. She reluctantly gave me a key to another room (first floor) and upon opening the door- GOOD LORD! smelt like the mummy's tomb! A whole new dimension of stinky than I've ever experience before! Back down to the front desk. A different clerk was at the desk and he quickly turned over a third key, this time on the forth floor. This room not only had a fine view of the pool and fitness room, but had only a vague mildew and tobacco smell, which reminded me of my youth and was oddly comforting. The rooms itself was quite clean, altho there was all kinds of garbage and room service debris in the hallways. The beds were EXTREMELY comfortable, the bathroom large and inviting, with funny little affectations such as a mirror in the shower. All in all I had a charming time, in an Adam's Family kind of way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Friendly Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amandalynsmith
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel through hotwire. We spent six nights there and were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and the friendliness of the staff. One night on our way back from the Texas Stadium, we became lost and we called the hotel asking for directions on how to get back and Adam was GREAT!!! He stayed on the phone with me until we were on the right freeway and almost to the hotel. This was a great hotel for the price and we will definitely stay there on our next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: tdely
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel after reading several reviews that were not so good. Worried about the hotel and the neighborhood after a car break in comment, I am happy to say that our stay was wonderful, the surrounding area around the hotel was nice, and the whole stay was great. We have nothing bad to say about this hotel. We frequently stay at holiday inns and this was a nice one.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff, great mattress”
Reviews.Author: Bruce RL
Reviews.Content: All staff members I dealt with were friendly and helpful. There are still some little things that need to be updated but overall the room was nicely redecorated, very clean, and quiet. The king mattress was wonderful, a nice blend of firmness and comfort. The restaurant menu is average, but the quality of the food was fine and the service was good. Amenities include an airline checkin PC in the lobby, which was useful. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacationLover58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn North Dallas to go to see the Red Sox play the Rangers. We paid $50.00 a night through bidding on priceline. The room was a very simple room, two double beds, bathroom and television. The furniture was a bit old / worn but the room was very clean. The hotel really isn't in walking distance to anything so I would only recommend staying here if you have a car. Also, if you are playing to go to games at Arlington, it is about a 1/2 hour drive, or a very expensive cab ride. The staff was extremely polite and helpful, and I highly recommend the breakfast buffett which was 10 dollars (about) and had all the coffee and juices you wanted, along with a bar where they will make you fresh eggs, omlets, pancakes, and waffles, along with the usuals like fresh fruit, bagels, toast, bacon, sausage and poatotes. Also, you get 10% of all food at the hotel if you are a Priority Club member.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice place..BIG ROOMS!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheDuskes
Reviews.Content: Nice place...very clean. Pool area is great for the kiddies. Lounge is nice and big with a few TV's Free WI-Fi in the whole building... Room was super big (Ask for a "corner King") Bed is really comfortable with 6 pillows. Bathroom has whirlpool jets but I'd never soak in there.... I was upset with the room service adding 18% + 2.00 delivery and then you have to tip the waiter. C'est la vie.... Paid 80.00 for this room and it was worth every cent. A couple of minutes from DFW and across the highway is a theater and some chain Restos.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: danib120
Reviews.Content: We were sorely disappointed. The photos & virtual tour online are not accurate. I even had called the hotel before I booked the room to verify that the suite had a separate room for the bedroom & 2 people told me it did. However when we arrived we got a 1 room "suite" & were told what we were looking for did not exist. In addition to having the hotel misrepresented & seemingly no one cared, our heater was broken in our room. After calling the desk 2 times about it (1 time I was hung up on) they sent someone to look at it. This took over 1/2 hour. He left saying he was going to go get some part for it & it would be 20 min or so. I called the desk again & we were moved to another room. This took longer than appreciated as well. After getting settled in our room we went to the pool area to "enjoy" the "whirlpool". It does not function properly. It simply bubbled up the sides while blowing cold water into it. Also the timer did not work. Dinner was ok. The in room movie prices are outrageous. It is cheaper to go to the cinema. Breakfast was met with a rude hostess informing us the breakfast buffet was not available. I had read the inroom info, but she did not care. Perhaps I got it wrong - but isn't the customer suppose to be treated courteously? Our waitress however was very nice & attentive & the food was good. Sincerely sorry to have stayed there

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My company sent me to Dallas to teach a class on our product. Months before we had reserved two rooms and a conference room for two days. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that our rooms were unavailable and they shipped us off to a Best Western for the night. The front desk was beyond uncaring. The conference room the next morning was not cleaned from the previous company that had rented it. The tablecloths had crumbs of food all and stains all over them. It was disgusting. There are over 350 rooms in this hotel and one washer and dryer. This is not very conducive to staying longer than a few days. The food is horrible and expensive even for hotel fare. There is an indoor/outdoor pool that causes the bar area to smell badly of chlorine (mainly, I think, because the lack air-conditioning in the halls of the hotel.) You could hear most anything that went on in the halls at night. Throughout the issues we had with the conference room, the front desk only seemed terribly bothered to have to listen to us. Several of the people who traveled to Dallas for our class had the same to report. All in all a terrible Hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Select Dallas North (Galleria Area)
HotelInfo.Address: 2645 L.B.J. Freeway, Dallas, TX 75234
